projectsExperience: I have work in many projects, from web applications, to serious games. Here are a few of them:

projects.name: Ifc-web-converter
projects.description:
I made a wrapper around Ifc Open shell, a library that allows you to convert IFC files to other formats (dae, obj, stl, etc) using different options.

It's built on React, Nodejs, three.js and Ifcopenshell.

The backend can be deployed on his own, which can be very useful not only for the web (where there are very good solutions such as ifc.js) but also for unity or unreal applications where plugins for this type of task are really expensive.

The front allows you to upload and preview your Ifc in a webgl canvas before downloading it.

It's fully dockerized(into three different containers) and deployed in AWS using pm2 to manage the nodejs process, allowing you to work in cluster mode for better perfomance.

projects.name: PY-web-image-scraper-classifier
projects.description:
As python is one of the vehicular languages in artificial intelligence concerns and it's incredible how AI and ML are improving day by day, I wanted to start learning about this subject.

For that reasons, I built a little pet project where I'm scrapping images from any website in order to classify them with tensorflow.
It's built on FastApi to expose a rest api for an easier management, and it's fully dockerized to deploy it anywhere (and not having to fight with CUDA drivers).

I think it could be useful to create image datasets or just analize websites to get contextual information about them.

projects.name: WebXR Light designer
projects.description:
A light designer built for a client who wanted to digitalize his comercialization pipelines.

The backend system was built with nodejs and a postgresql database. The frontend was built using webgl (Three.js) technologies. JavaScript language was used across backend and frontend.

It allowed any customer to create a light design and get the components and prices of all the accesories and send orders to our client.
